intro: Henriettella parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered henriettella, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Henriettella parviflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its foliage is heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
